comment.text: Cytochromes P450 are a group of heme-thiolate monooxygenases. In liver microsomes, this enzyme is involved in an NADPH-dependent electron transport pathway. It oxidizes a variety of structurally unrelated compounds, including steroids, fatty acids, and xenobiotics. In the epoxidation of arachidonic acid it generates only 14,15- and 11,12-cis-epoxyeicosatrienoic acids. It is the principal enzyme responsible for the metabolism the anti-cancer drug paclitaxel (taxol).
RH + [reduced NADPH--hemoprotein reductase] + O(2) = ROH + [oxidized NADPH--hemoprotein reductase] + H(2)O.

kinetics.Vmax: 2.18 pmol/min/pmol enzyme with paclitaxel as substrate
11.30 pmol/min/pmol enzyme with amodiaquine as substrate

comment.text: Several alleles are found in the human population, contributing to interindividual variations in the therapeutic efficacy and toxicity of a myriad of drugs such as paclitaxel or amodiaquine. The allele shown here is CYP2C8*1 (PubMed:26427316). CYP2C8 genetic variations may be associated with adverse effects of cerivastatin including acute rhabdomyolysis [MIM:601129].
Belongs to the cytochrome P450 family.
Alternative splicing has been shown to occur but the shorter forms are believed to be non-functional.

property.value: Synthesis of epoxy (EET) and dihydroxyeicosatrienoic acids (DHET)

feature.description: In allele CYP2C8*3; reduces enzymatic activity with paclitaxel as substrate; decreases intrinsic clearance of paclitaxel; reduces enzymatic activity with amodiaquine as substrate; dbSNP:rs11572080.

In allele CYP2C8*6; no effect on affinity or enzymatic activity with paclitaxel as substrate; decreases affinity for amodiaquine; reduces enzymatic activity with amodiaquine as substrate; decreases intrinsic clearance of amodiaquine; dbSNP:rs142886225.

In allele CYP2C8*8; increases affinity for paclitaxel; reduces enzymatic activity with paclitaxel as substrate; decreases intrinsic clearance of paclitaxel; reduces enzymatic activity with amodiaquine as substrate; decreases intrinsic clearance of amodiaquine; dbSNP:rs72558195.

In allele CYP2C8*13; reduces enzymatic activity with paclitaxel as substrate; decreases intrinsic clearance of paclitaxel; reduces enzymatic activity with amodiaquine as substrate; decreases intrinsic clearance of amodiaquine.
In allele CYP2C8*14; reduces enzymatic activity with paclitaxel as substrate; decreases intrinsic clearance of paclitaxel; dbSNP:rs188934928.

In allele CYP2C8*9; increases enzymatic activity with paclitaxel as substrate; reduces enzymatic activity with amodiaquine as substrate; decreases intrinsic clearance of amodiaquine; dbSNP:rs769460274.
In allele CYP2C8*4; reduces enzymatic activity with paclitaxel as substrate; decreases affinity for amodiaquine; dbSNP:rs1058930.

In allele CYP2C8*2; only found in African-Americans; increases intrinsic clearance of paclitaxel; decreases affinity for amodiaquine; increases enzymatic activity with amodiaquine as substrate; dbSNP:rs11572103.
In allele CYP2C8*10; reduces enzymatic activity with paclitaxel as substrate; reduces enzymatic activity with amodiaquine as substrate; decreases intrinsic clearance of amodiaquine.
In allele CYP2C8*3; reduces enzymatic activity with paclitaxel as substrate; decreases intrinsic clearance of paclitaxel; reduces enzymatic activity with amodiaquine as substrate; dbSNP:rs10509681.
In allele CYP2C8*12; increases enzymatic activity with paclitaxel as substrate; reduces enzymatic activity with amodiaquine as substrate; decreases intrinsic clearance of amodiaquine.
In Ref. 1; AAA35739/AAA35740 and 3; no nucleotide entry.
